lines.text:
[Lewis and Irene are seated at the bar; Lewis knocks over Irene's drink]
Oh, I'm sorry. Stupid of me.
I see you done better than that.
You're quick on the uptake! My name's Canfield, Lewis Canfield. What's yours?
I'm sorry I was late, Mr Bridges. I was waiting until you were free to come and apologise.
Yes, of course. I hear some rather disturbing reports about you. The whole town's talking...
But surely, Sir, my private life is my affair.
Yes. You've seemed a trifle worried lately. And people will, eh.

Precisely. Of course it's quite ridiculous but banks have that curious idiosyncrasy of hoping that their employees will conduct their private affairs in a manner which will not give cause for people to talk at all.
Yes. Except of course that I should be very sorry to see so promising a career become, eh, less promising. Thank you, Mr Ross.
She's just rotten all through and nothing'll change her. Not you, nor anybody else!
